image.altText: Two election posters on a stobie pole showing Peter Malinauskas and Steven Marshall. In the background is the city skyline

props.synopsis: SA's electoral commission is concerned the state's corflute ban is leaving some voters unaware that elections are taking place.

title.children: No corflutes, no election? Some voters left in the dark by SA poster ban

image.altText: A radar map showing rain passing over Kangaroo Island.

props.synopsis: Wild weather warnings are in place for much of SA as cold fronts push showers and strong winds across the state, while Kangaroo Island ferry services have been cancelled because of the rough conditions.

title.children: SA to get burst of wild weather after months-long dry spell

image.altText: A man stands in the shallows on Kangaroo Island.

props.synopsis: The scale of South Australia's toxic algal bloom has previously been likened to the size of Kangaroo Island, and on the island itself tourism operators and fishers — both commercial and recreational — are among those who could be heavily impacted.

title.children: How an 'ocean COVID' is harming marine businesses

image.altText: Dead sea life under the water, grey clouds above the water

props.synopsis: A mysterious, brown foam appeared on a beach an hour south of Adelaide. It was just the beginning of a toxic algal bloom that has now grown to thousands of square kilometres in size, killing precious sea life in its wake. Experts say it could be a sign of things to come.

title.children: A mysterious brown foam appeared on a beach. Hours later, dead sea life followed

image.altText: GettyImages-2210971209

props.synopsis: Damien Hardwick tells the Saints to focus on their own backyard after Ross Lyon called the Suns the 'nepo baby' of the AFL.

title.children: 'Disrespectful': Hardwick hits out at Lyon over 'nepo baby' comment

image.altText: Destroyed fertiliser silo

props.synopsis: A farmer in Victoria's north-west has taken extreme measures to salvage his stored fertiliser by smashing six silos worth $150,000 to the ground so that he can use it.

title.children: Silos smashed as grain growers face costly nightmare of 'clumped' fertiliser

image.altText: Vast, brown landscape with a couple of trees in the background

props.synopsis: As floods batter some parts of Australia, others are experiencing their worst drought on record. The two extremes may give a glimpse of our future climate.

title.children: Flooded towns give way to dustbowls in a land of weather extremes

image.altText: Image of man with serious face and black shirt

props.synopsis: A reality TV personality, who was a topless waiter at a 60th birthday celebration, was being a "good Samaritan" when he was stabbed while protecting a woman at the event, a court has heard.

title.children: Reality TV star stabbed at 60th party was protecting woman, court hears

image.altText: The South Australia Police logo on a building.

props.synopsis: SA Police has confirmed that an internal inquiry into an incident at Davenport, near Port Augusta, has found that claims a police officer used excessive force "were not substantiated".

title.children: SA Police internal inquiry into Davenport incident 'almost complete'

image.altText: An old stone building with a red dome

props.synopsis: A woman has told a court that her religious beliefs have been "tainted" after she was sexually assaulted as a teenager by a senior member in a South Australian church.

title.children: 14yo girl's sexual abuse by senior SA church member ignored, court hears

image.altText: a house for sale in the brisbane suburb of stafford with the sale sign in the front yard

props.synopsis: With housing affordability now improving as interest rates come down, housing accessibility is likely to worsen further as prices again rise.

title.children: History is repeating and house prices are set to rise — again

image.altText: Aunty Angelique has grey shoulder length hair and is wearing a white and blue top with flowers on it

props.synopsis: Stolen from her family, Angelique Wittwer could only return home and reconnect thanks to a compensation payment. But survivors in other states don't have the same opportunity.

title.children: 'Finally home': Stolen Generations survivor on finding her community

image.altText: Headshot of Sue-Yen Luiten

props.synopsis: There's a fear that follows Sue-Yen Luiten as she cycles through the Mekong Delta with hundreds of DNA kits in tow. What if her birth parents have been looking for her and it's too late?

title.children: Sue is using DNA to find her mum. On the way, she found a different family

image.altText: Carlos Sainz of Spain driving the (55) Williams FW-47 on track during

props.synopsis: Lando Norris has survived an early scare and a tense finish to win his first Monaco Grand Prix, a race that threatens to be remembered for slow, negative driving.

title.children: Monaco Grand Prix soured by 'silly' deliberately slow driving

image.altText: A shirtless Novak Djokovic gestures.

props.synopsis: Novak Djokovic is in decline even as he grabbed more tennis history in Geneva. What remains to be seen is whether he still can get through a two-week major with his mind and body intact.

title.children: Djokovic's racquet bag is a flex on opponents. It should also remind him who he is

image.altText: A man with greying hair and glasses holds a bottle containing off-white liquid to his eyes.

props.synopsis: Formula One is transitioning to sustainable fuels next year. Australia could manufacture them and make billions of dollars -- if it doesn't miss the opportunity.

title.children: 'Two or three times the cost': Roadblock to synthetic fuel at the bowser

image.altText: A fiery scene shows houses ablaze after drone strikes near Kyiv, with silhouetted emergency crews in the distance.

props.synopsis: The attack, which took place for a second straight night amid an ongoing prisoner swap, was the largest of the war to date in terms of the raw number of strikes, according to Ukraine's air force.

title.children: Massive Russian aerial attack on Ukraine kills at least 12, officials say

image.altText: King Penguins with Greg Mortimer from land, Salisbury Plain, South Georgia, Lina Stock @ Divergent Travelers

props.synopsis: A new forecast suggests annual tourist numbers in Antarctica could almost quadruple within a decade, prompting calls for mitigation measures to reduce potential impacts on the continent's sensitive environment.

title.children: Icebergs and 450,000 tourists: The potential scenario facing Antarctica

image.altText: A woman stares into the face of a man who has white pieces of wet material stuck over his head and torso.

props.synopsis: The strange and disturbing phenomenon of exhibiting humans in zoos was once considered a European thing, but a boomerang found under topsoil in a Melbourne park contradicts that.

title.children: The disturbing practice of 'human zoos' happened right under our noses

image.altText: A young girl in an orange shirt smiling

props.synopsis: The police search of Good Night Scrub National Park enters its third day, as the teen's mother calls for people to leave the light on to "help guide" Pheobe home.

title.children: Police dogs join search of dense scrub for missing 17yo Pheobe Bishop

image.altText: Two young kids, arm in arm, sit in a classroom.

props.synopsis: At these Australian schools, entire days or various subjects are taught in different languages.

title.children: This type of school is common in Europe. Australia is catching on

image.altText: a woman holding a tray of cookies

props.synopsis: Influencer baker Brooke Bellamy said her recipes are "inspired by somewhere or someone" in her first video blog since cookbook author Nagi Maehashi accused her of plagiarism.

title.children: Brooke Bellamy posts first video since plagiarism claims

image.altText: A satellite image of a  structure covered in blue tarp laying horizontally in blue water to the side of a concrete harbour jetty

props.synopsis: Authorities in Pyongyang have detained a chief engineer, the head of hull construction and an administrative affairs official after a 5,000-tonne destroyer was damaged during a failed launch ceremony.

title.children: Three officials arrested over failed North Korean warship launch

image.altText: Vast, brown landscape with a couple of trees in the background

props.synopsis: As floods batter some parts of Australia, others are experiencing their worst drought on record. The two extremes may give a glimpse of our future climate.

title.children: Flooded towns give way to dustbowls in a land of weather extremes

image.altText: A couple does a housing inspection in an empty apartment building with white walls.

props.synopsis: Another rate cut is likely to mean more competition and higher prices for housing. But home buyers are feeling the pressure for other reasons too.

title.children: 'Eight-week window' sends buyers into overdrive in the housing market

image.altText: Anthony Albanese raises hands with son, partner and Penny Wong in front of a crowd.

props.synopsis: Over four months, Labor clawed its way back from an uninspiring showing in the polls to a historic victory so unbelievable even the party's most faithful servants couldn't have imagined it.

title.children: How Labor pulled off a landslide no one saw coming

image.altText: Illustration of woman standing under umbrella with lots of writing bouncing off the outside umbrella.

props.synopsis: With burnout at unprecedented levels, who doesn't dream of stepping away from it all and embracing a career break? The question is whether it can solve the root problem.

title.children: Meet the burnt-out millennials who walked away from work and found life

image.altText: A bald man with a dark beard smiling in a selfie alongside a young boy and girl also smiling

props.synopsis: Alaa al-Najjar, a Gazan paediatrician, found her family's house on fire after the strikes, her husband, fellow doctor Hamdi al-Najjar, was severely wounded and their only surviving child, an 11-year-old son, is in a critical condition.

title.children: Nine of doctors' 10 children killed in Israeli strikes, ministry says

image.altText: A composite of two men

props.synopsis: Two Palestinians released during the Gaza ceasefire have detailed shocking claims against Israeli forces, while the IDF insists all prisoners and detainees were treated appropriately. WARNING: Some readers might find the details and images in this story distressing.

title.children: 'They detain dogs with humans': Shocking claims from Gaza detainees

image.altText: Karen Mundine smiles for a photo, she is wearing a black shirt with pink flowers.

props.synopsis: The theme for 2025 is "Bridging Now to Next", prompting Australians to look ahead and continue to push forward towards a more united and respectful nation, with past lessons as guidance.

title.children: Here are the ways you can be part of Reconciliation Week

image.altText: David Littleproud arrives for Nationals leadership ballot

props.synopsis: Nationals leader David Littleproud says he doesn't care if he loses his job over his role in ending the Coalition, saying he stood up for his party and his colleagues.

title.children: Littleproud 'relaxed' as Nationals leadership questions roil beneath him

image.altText: Angus Taylor, Jim Chalmers 20221026_192814850_iOS

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers held a press conference last week that will enter Australian political folklore, announcing major twin victories: one economic, one political.

title.children: Chalmers did not miss historic moment to take revenge on 'smoking ruin'

image.altText: A portrait of Queen Mary wearing a white dress and blue slash and a crown.

props.synopsis: Queen Mary of Teck, grandmother of Queen Elizabeth II, was a reserved intellectual. But some historians and descendants argue she was also an "upmarket kleptomaniac".

title.children: The English queen who collected treasures through controversial means
